title: League is literally based out of SJW's

Look at it from your other teammates perspective: instead of having to deal with 1 troll or maybe a bad player - they now have to deal with that player PLUS someone throwing a tantrum.

And if that trolling player was a true troll, he will only delight in your respons and you will be rewarding him (which is never worth in my opinion - those people do not deserve the statisfaction).
 
If he was simply playing badly, you will only push him over the edge, lowering everyones chances to win (which is also not worth - I still want to win dammit, despite chances being low)

So lashing out ingame is ALWAYS a lose-lose situation. There is no f-ing way it ever makes sense, especially when there are other ways to vent frustration.

> [{quoted}](name=Kethoos Baad,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=y3IHQHpB,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-11-04T13:38:41.146+0000)What happened with a game being a game? League doesn't encourge people with skill at all, they only focus on to punish those who are angry...

*League* is designed to be a game anyone can play, not just a game for players who are "good." It's also designed to be a fun, friendly experience whenever possible, so players who find enjoyment in harassing or insulting other players are the antithesis of what *League* wants in a player.

By all means be bad -- the MMR system exists for this reason, and if you're bad you'll end up playing with other bad players. If you're an asshole, however, you're not building a fun environment, and Riot wants you to either change your behavior or leave. It's not because of the fear that people are being offended -- it's because you've literally decided that YOUR fun can only be had at the expense of someone else.

Because it's Riot's game, on Riot's servers, and organizations are allowed to make rules like that. You can't go repeatedly insulting someone at most coffee shops or movie theaters and expect to be able to stick around, and it's perfectly fine for a company to go "Hey...we have a certain behavioral requirement for the people we let into our community."

If you don't like it, there are other games you can play.

And no, the player base isn't 12. The majority of the player base, however, doesn't see the need to enable insults or harassment as part of "fun," and feels that those who DO need to do that should find one of the many other games where they CAN.

> [{quoted}](name=Kethoos Baad,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=y3IHQHpB,comment-id=0008000000010000,timestamp=2017-11-04T17:51:32.884+0000)You're right but i'm just ranting. 

That's fair. :)

>Thought people were mature enough to not take words from the internet so hard. 

Most of us are. The issue is that *there is no reason to start abusing or insulting someone in a recreational activity.* Accepting abuse isn't a sign of maturity, but being able to feel emotions without turning those emotions into an attack on someone else *is*. It's not that we're "offended" or "hurt" so much as it's clear that the person doing the insulting isn't respectful of his fellow players, and likely isn't playing the game for the right reasons.

No one is telling you you can't be angry, or frustrated, or upset. They're saying that you need to learn to deal with that responsibly instead of attacking other people. The responsibility for outbursts does not lie with the people insulted, but rather with the one doing the insulting.

Considering League has a Teen rating it could very well have players this young.  I'm very much supportive of Riot trimming the community of players that prey on pushing people's buttons for an advantage since friendly banter can't exist until you get to know the players in game. 

If you are so set on keeping this train of though might I recommend a game more your pace then?  I've heard COD is out again so I'm sure they have plenty of like minded players willing to 'banter' with you.
